page.title: 04BEEF FARMING IN RATHFRILAND
page.content: BEEF FARMING IS AN EVER GROWING INDUSTRY. FARMERS BUY THEIR CALVES WHEN THE ANIMALS ARE ABOUT 1.5 YEARS OLD.THESE CALVES ARE USUALLY BOUGHT IN OCTOBER AND PUT STRAIGHT INTO A CATTLE HOUSE ALL WINTER.DURING THIS TIME THEY ARE FED SILAGE AND CONCENTRATES. TO KEEP CATTLE OVER THE WINTER MONTHS THE CATTLE MUST BE LOOKED AFTER AND SO THERE ARE SPECIAL SHEDS BUILT TO BE MORE CONVENIENT FOR THE FARMER AND TO KEEP THE CATTLE WARM AND HEALTHY DURING THE COLD WEATHER. THE CATTLE MUST ALSO HAVE PLENTY OF VENTILATION. THE CATTLE ARE THEN GRAZED THROUGHOUT THE SUMMER ON GOOD GRASSLAND AND ARE FATTENED TO BE SOLD IN SEPTEMBER OR OCTOBER WHEN THEY WEIGH ABOUT 600 - 700 kgs.
